article: Mr. Smith worked in a big computer company. He had no wife, and of course, had no child,  _  . He lived in an old house  _  . He liked nothing but drinking. He almost spent all of his money  _  drinks. One night, Mr. Smith met a friend of his on his way home. The man asked him to have dinner in a  _  . He was happy and drank a lot. When they  finished  the meal, Mr. Smith could hardly walk. His friend had to stop a taxi and asked the driver to take him  home  . Soon the taxi arrived at Mr. Smith's house. With the help of the  _  , he got out of the taxi. "Thank you, sir," said Mr. Smith. "And I can  _  the door by myself." The taxi driver then went away. But Mr. Smith couldn't put the key into the key hole. He tried many times  _  he still failed. At that time, a policeman passed there. "Can I help you open the door, sir?" asked the policeman. "Thank you, sir. But I don't think you can." said Mr. Smith. "My house is circling now. If you can stop it from  _  , I can open the door by myself."
